meanings.definition: A person or thing that spawns.
meanings.sent1: The fish in the river was a spawner, laying eggs for the next generation.
meanings.sent2: The bird was a spawner, building a nest for its young.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome acted like a spawner, magically creating tiny statues overnight.
meanings.sent4: The artist was a spawner of creativity, inspiring others with their work.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee was the spawner of the hive, ensuring its growth and prosperity.

meanings.definition: An organism that produces or releases eggs or sperm.
meanings.sent1: The frog was a spawner, laying hundreds of eggs in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The salmon was a spawner, swimming upstream to spawn.
meanings.sent3: The flower was a spawner, spreading pollen to create new plants.
meanings.sent4: The tree was a spawner of seeds, scattering them far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The coral was a spawner, releasing millions of tiny eggs into the ocean.
